name: OwaspZapScan
helpMarkDown: [Help for Owasp Zap Scan v#{Version}](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=solucionespsg.owasp-zap-scan-psg) [More Information](https://github.com/pablosguajardo/owasp-zap-scanner) Versioned with [Update Version Variables And Package](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=solucionespsg.UpdateVersionVariablesAndPackage) Published with [Generate and publish vsix to Marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=solucionespsg.GenerateAndPublishVsixToMarketplace) Complemented with [Owasp Zap OnPremise Start/Stop](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=solucionespsg.OwaspZapOnPremiseStartStop)
author: PSG

inputs.name: ZapApiUrl
inputs.label: ZAP API Url
inputs.helpMarkDown: Full Api Url

inputs.name: ZapApiKey
inputs.label: API Key
inputs.helpMarkDown: API key by default in order to invoke API operations that make changes to ZAP. API key is required by default in order to invoke any of the API operations. This is a security feature to prevent malicious sites from invoking the ZAP API.

inputs.name: TargetUrl
inputs.label: Target URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: Target URL to scan, including the protocol, eg https://www.example.com

inputs.name: ClearSession
inputs.label: New Session
inputs.helpMarkDown: Creates a new session, optionally overwriting existing files. If a relative path is specified it will be resolved against the 'session' directory in ZAP 'home' dir.

inputs.name: NewContext
inputs.label: New Context
inputs.helpMarkDown: Create a new Context, optionally.

inputs.name: NewContextName
inputs.label: New Context Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the new context.

inputs.name: ExecuteAjaxSpiderScan
inputs.label: Execute Ajax Spider
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable to run a Ajax spider scan on the target.

inputs.name: AjaxInScope
inputs.label: In Scope
inputs.helpMarkDown: A boolean (true/false) indicating whether or not the scan should be restricted to 'inScope' only resources (default value is false). Enable to use the nodes underneath the one specified target to seed the Ajax spider.

inputs.name: AjaxSubTreeOnly
inputs.label: Sub tree only
inputs.helpMarkDown: A boolean (true/false) indicating whether or not the crawl should be constrained to a specific path (default value is false). Enable to use the nodes underneath the one specified target to seed the Ajax spider.

inputs.name: AjaxContextName
inputs.label: Context Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name for any defined context. If the value does not match a defined context then an error will occur.

inputs.name: ExecuteSpiderScan
inputs.label: Execute Spider
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable to run a spider scan on the target.

inputs.name: RecurseSpider
inputs.label: Recurse
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'recurse' parameter can be used to scan URLs under the given URL.

inputs.name: SubtreeOnly
inputs.label: Sub tree Only
inputs.helpMarkDown: The parameter 'subtreeOnly' allows to restrict the spider under a site's subtree (using the specified 'URL').

inputs.name: ContextName
inputs.label: Context Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The parameter 'contextName' can be used to constrain the scan to a Context. Is the name for any defined context. If the value does not match a defined context then an error will occur.

inputs.name: MaxChildrenToCrawl
inputs.label: Max Children to scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: 'maxChildren' parameter can be set to limit the number of children scanned and the 'recurse' parameter can be used to prevent the spider from seeding recursively.

inputs.name: ExecuteOpenApiScan
inputs.label: Execute Open Api Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: The OpenAPI Support add-on for ZAP allows users to spider and import OpenAPI (Swagger) definitions, versions 1.2, 2.0, and 3.0. This add-on automatically detects any OpenAPI definitions and spiders them as long as they are in scope. [More Information desktop](https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/openapi-support) & [More Information api](https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/api/#zap-api-openapi)

inputs.name: OpenApiUrl
inputs.label: Url
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter data in URL or File. Not both. Url: The URL locating the OpenAPI definition. The url must exist and be accessible from the server running ZAP. If not, it will give an error. [More Information](https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/openapi-support)

inputs.name: OpenApiFile
inputs.label: File
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enter data in URL or File. Not both. The file that contains the OpenAPI definition. [More Information](https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/openapi-support)

inputs.name: OpenApiHostOverride
inputs.label: HostOverride/Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: HostOverride: The Target URL (called hostOverride for historical reasons) to override the server URL present in the definition. Target: The Target URL to override the server URL present in the definition. [More Information](https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/openapi-support)

inputs.name: OpenApiContextId
inputs.label: Context ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Scan context identifier. [More Information](https://www.zaproxy.org/docs/desktop/addons/openapi-support)

inputs.name: ContinueOnUrlError
inputs.label: Continue on url error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If the provided url is not accessible from ZAP, an error will occur. If this option is activated, the rest of the scans will follow.

inputs.name: ExecuteActiveScan
inputs.label: Execute Active Scan
inputs.helpMarkDown: Active scanning attempts to find potential vulnerabilities by using known attacks against the selected targets. Active scanning is an attack on those targets. You should NOT use it on applications that you do not have permission to.

inputs.name: ContextId
inputs.label: Context ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Scan context identifier

inputs.name: Recurse
inputs.label: Recurse
inputs.helpMarkDown: The 'recurse' parameter can be used to scan URLs under the given URL.

inputs.name: InScopeOnly
inputs.label: In Scope Only
inputs.helpMarkDown: The parameter 'inScopeOnly' can be used to constrain the scan to URLs that are in scope (ignored if a Context is specified).

inputs.name: ScanPolicyName
inputs.label: Scan Policy Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The parameter 'scanPolicyName' allows to specify the scan policy (if none is given it uses the default scan policy).

inputs.name: Method
inputs.label: Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: The parameters 'method' and 'postData' allow to select a given request in conjunction with the given URL.

inputs.name: PostData
inputs.label: POST Data
inputs.helpMarkDown: The parameters 'method' and 'postData' allow to select a given request in conjunction with the given URL.

inputs.name: EnableVerifications
inputs.label: Enable Verifications
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable to add thresholds for security risk types and fail the build if the threshold is exceeded.

inputs.name: MaxHighRiskAlerts
inputs.label: High Risk Alert Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of Maximum allowed High Risk Alerts

inputs.name: MaxMediumRiskAlerts
inputs.label: Medium Risk Alert Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of Maximum allowed Medium Risk Alerts

inputs.name: MaxLowRiskAlerts
inputs.label: Low Risk Alert Threshold
inputs.helpMarkDown: Number of Maximum allowed Low Risk Alerts

inputs.name: ReportType
inputs.label: Report Type
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the type of report you want generated. Available types are *HTML*, *XML*, *Markdown* or *All*

inputs.name: ReportFileDestination
inputs.label: Destination Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: The destination folder that the report file is created. You can use [variables](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=550988). Eg.: _$(agent.builddirectory)_

inputs.name: ReportFileName
inputs.label: Report Filename
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the report file, without the extension. Extension is determined by the *Report Type*. Eg. OWASP-ZAP-Report.xml
